## File Tree 

<LinkCard title="File Tree Documentation" href="http://localhost:4321/jb2a-wiki/template/website-cmd#file-tree"/>


    ```js 
    import { FileTree } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';
    <FileTree>

    - astro.config.mjs
    - package.json
    - src
      - components
        - Header.astro
        - Title.astro
      - pages/

    </FileTree>
    ```
<FileTree>

- astro.config.mjs
- package.json
- src
  - components
    - Header.astro
    - Title.astro
  - pages/

</FileTree>

```js 
import { LinkButton } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

<LinkButton href="/jb2a-wiki/src/content/docs/getting-started/jb2a-fvtt/" variant="secondary">
  Get started - Foundry VTT
</LinkButton>
```

## Github References:

### Merge new changes from main to my local branch
:::note
You need to make sure your current branch(dev1) is up to date with the main branch to avoid conflicts.
:::

## Steps
<Steps>

1. Import the component into your MDX file:

    ```js
    import { Steps } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';
    ```

2. Wrap `<Steps>` around your ordered list items.

</Steps>

## Aside (Callouts)

:::danger
The `<Steps>` component does not accept any props
:::

## [Discord JS Formatting Code](#JS-Formatting)
:::note
You can format code in Discord like so:

\`\`\`js  
Code here  
\`\`\`  

:::



<Steps>
1. You can stash your changes on your current branch(this will store your changes in a stash while you pull the latest on main):

    ```js
    git stash
    ```

2. Then check out main and pull the latests changes

    ```js
    git checkout main
    git pull
    ```
3. From there you can check out your branch:


    ```js
    git checkout branchName
    ```

4. Then merge the latest changes from main into your branch:

    ```js
    git merge main
    ```

5. After that step you can pop your stash into your newly updated branch:

    ```js
    git stash pop
    ```

6. And now your branch(dev1) has all the latest changes from main as well as the changes you've made locally

</Steps>

### Delete your branch

<Steps>
1. Delete the local branch:


    ```js
    git branch -d branchName
    ```

    :::note 
    use uppercase -D if you want to delete a branch, even though it hasn't been merged


2. To delete a remote branch: 


    ```js
    git push origin --delete branchName 
    ```
</Steps>
